Activity: Arrive at work, brew a cup of calming chamomile tea, and settle in for the day. Check personal email for any interesting articles or creative prompts.
Log in to the work system and review any urgent emails or messages related to the help desk project. Prioritize tasks based on urgency and impact.

Begin working on the help desk ticketing system. Focus on the user interface for submitting tickets. Brainstorm ways to make the interface intuitive and user-friendly, considering the diverse technical skills of the hospital staff.
Take a short break to stretch and listen to a calming instrumental piece to clear my head and get fresh ideas.
Continue implementing the ticket submission form. Add fields for describing the issue, selecting the affected system, and uploading relevant screenshots or documents.
Lunch break. Take a walk outside in the small garden near the hospital to clear my head and enjoy the fresh air.
Research best practices for help desk ticket categorization. Aim to make the system easier to track and analyze tickets.

Begin development of the email channel for support. Research existing libraries or services to simplify processing incoming emails and automatically creating tickets. @EHRDEV-1 @EHRDEV-2 Topic: API and Backend for Help Desk Ticketing System
Review the day's progress and document any challenges encountered. Make a list of tasks to be completed tomorrow.
Check personal email and browse design inspiration websites for UI/UX ideas for the help desk portal.
